newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai CPI average 5.9 pct in first 11 mths - official.
newsitem.headline: Thai CPI average 5.9 pct in first 11 mths - official.

text.p: The Thai consumer price index rose a moving average of 5.9 percent year-on-year during January/November against 5.7 pct in the same period a year ago, a senior commerce ministry official said on Tuesday.
Sompol Kiatpaibul, permanent secretary for commerce, told an economic seminar he expected Thai inflation for the whole of 1996 to average 5.8 percent, unchanged from 1995.
He did not give the actual November CPI. The index is normally calculated by the commerce ministry by the 25th of each month.
The official said CPI was projected to ease to about 5.5 percent in 1997 based on expected stable oil and lower commodity prices next year.
He said costs of domestic manufactured products and construction materials were also likely to be kept from rising substantially in 1997 because of competition.
